subsection.subsectiontext: On request or on the minister's own initiative the minister or a person authorized by the minister, by advertising in the prescribed manner, may invite applications for a forest licence.
[Repealed 2003-32-4.]
The regional manager must not enter into a forest licence under this section unless it is advertised as provided in subsection (1).
An application for a forest licence must

paragraph.paragraphtext: be in the form specified by the minister or a person authorized by the minister,
be submitted in a sealed container to the minister or a person authorized by the minister,
if required in the invitation for applications advertised under subsection (1), include a proposal, providing information the minister or a person authorized by the minister requests, for

subparagraph.subparagraphtext: continuing, establishing or expanding a timber processing facility in British Columbia, and
meeting the objectives of the government in respect of any of the items referred to in subsection (4), and

paragraph.paragraphtext: include an offer by the applicant to pay to the government, in addition to other amounts payable under this Act and the regulations, stumpage under Part 7 and a bonus offer, if any, in the amount tendered in the application.

subsection.subsectiontext: The minister or a person authorized by the minister must evaluate each application, including its potential for

paragraph.paragraphtext: creating or maintaining employment opportunities and other social benefits in British Columbia,
providing for the management and utilization of Crown timber,
furthering the development objectives of the government,
meeting objectives of the government in respect of environmental quality and the management of water, fisheries, wildlife and cultural heritage resources, and
contributing to government revenues.

subsection.subsectiontext: The minister or a person authorized by the minister may

paragraph.paragraphtext: approve one or more applications,

agree with an applicant to dispose of a smaller volume of timber than was applied for or to include other terms and conditions the minister or a person authorized by the minister considers necessary, or
reject any or all applications.

subsection.subsectiontext: If the minister or a person authorized by the minister approves an application the regional manager and the applicant must enter into an agreement in the form of a forest licence.
This section does not apply to a forest licence entered into under sections 15 to 17 and 47.3.

subsection.subsectiontext: On request or on his or her own initiative and by advertising in the prescribed manner, the regional manager, timber sales manager or district manager

paragraph.paragraphtext: may invite applications for a timber sale licence, and
in doing so,

subparagraph.subparagraphtext: may specify that applications for the timber sale licence are to be accepted only from one or more categories of BC timber sales enterprises as established by regulation, and
must require that the applicant by written tender in a sealed container propose only a bonus bid or only a bonus offer.

subsection.subsectiontext: An application for a timber sale licence must

paragraph.paragraphtext: be in the form required by the regional manager or timber sales manager, and
include an offer by the applicant to pay to the government, in addition to other amounts payable under this Act and the regulations,

subparagraph.subparagraphtext: stumpage under Part 7,

either a bonus bid or bonus offer, whichever is required under subsection (2), in the amount tendered.

subsection.subsectiontext: On receipt of applications and tenders in response to an invitation advertised under subsection (2), the regional manager, timber sales manager or district manager

paragraph.paragraphtext: must approve the eligible application of the applicant whose proposed bonus bid or bonus offer is the highest of those tendered by all applicants with eligible applications, or
at the direction of the minister, must decline to approve any of the eligible applications.

subsection.subsectiontext: If the applicant referred to in subsection (4) does not enter into a timber sale licence as required under subsection (6), the regional manager, timber sales manager or district manager

paragraph.paragraphtext: may approve the eligible application of the applicant whose proposed bonus bid or bonus offer is the next highest of those tendered by all applicants with eligible applications, or
may decline to approve any of the eligible applications.

subsection.subsectiontext: If an eligible application is approved under this section, the regional manager, timber sales manager or district manager and the applicant whose application is approved must enter into a timber sale licence.

subsection.subsectiontext: On request or on his or her own initiative the minister or a person authorized by the minister, by an advertisement published in the prescribed manner, may invite applications for a timber sale licence, and may specify in the advertisement that applications for the timber sale licence will be accepted only from one or more categories of small business forest enterprises as established by regulation.
An application for a timber sale licence must

paragraph.paragraphtext: be in the form specified by the minister or a person authorized by the minister,
be submitted in a sealed container to the minister or a person authorized by the minister,

if the advertisement required by subsection (1) so specifies, include a proposal to the minister or to a person authorized by the minister, containing the information that the minister or the person authorized by the minister requests, and

include an offer by the applicant to pay to the government, in addition to other amounts payable under this Act and the regulations, stumpage under Part 7 and the amount of the bonus offer or bonus bid, if any, in the amount tendered.

subsection.subsectiontext: The minister or a person authorized by the minister must evaluate each application, including its potential for

paragraph.paragraphtext: creating or maintaining employment opportunities and other social benefits in British Columbia,
providing for the management and utilization of Crown timber,
furthering the development objectives of the government,
meeting objectives of the government in respect of environmental quality and the management of water, fisheries, wildlife and cultural heritage resources, and
contributing to government revenues.

subsection.subsectiontext: The minister or a person authorized by the minister may

paragraph.paragraphtext: approve one or more applications,
approve an application subject to conditions that the applicant must comply with before the timber sale licence is entered into,
agree with an applicant

subparagraph.subparagraphtext: to dispose of a smaller volume of timber than was applied for, or
to include other terms and conditions the minister or a person authorized by the minister considers necessary, or

paragraph.paragraphtext: reject any or all applications.

subsection.subsectiontext: If an application is made in accordance with this section in response to the advertisement, and the minister or a person authorized by the minister

paragraph.paragraphtext: approves the application under subsection (4) (a) or (c), the regional manager or district manager must enter into a timber sale licence, or
approves the application under subsection (4) (b), the regional manager or district manager must enter into a timber sale licence if the conditions referred to in that subsection have been met.

subsection.subsectiontext: If an applicant does not comply with the conditions referred to in subsection (4) (b),

paragraph.paragraphtext: the regional or district manager, by written notice served on the applicant and without a hearing, may refuse to enter into the timber sale licence, and

if the regional or district manager refuses to enter into the timber sale licence, the minister or person authorized by the minister, in accordance with this section, may approve the application of another person for a timber sale licence for all or part of the advertised volume of timber.

subsection.subsectiontext: A timber sale licence entered into under this section is not replaceable.

subsection.subsectiontext: In this section, designated applicant means the holder of a timber sale licence

paragraph.paragraphtext: entered into under the former Act, that was in force on January 1, 1979, and

subparagraph.subparagraphtext: to which section 17 (1a) of the former Act applied, or
that the regional manager has designated to be subject to subsection (3), or

paragraph.paragraphtext: entered into pursuant to a request under subsection (3) by its holder or by a previous holder of the licence.

subsection.subsectiontext: Despite section 20, the regional manager or a district manager with the approval of the regional manager, without advertising or accepting applications from other persons, may enter into an agreement in the form of a timber sale licence with a designated applicant if the designated applicant makes a request under subsection (3).
A designated applicant, within one year before the expiry of one or more timber sale licences referred to in subsection (1), may

paragraph.paragraphtext: request one or more timber sale licences that would

subparagraph.subparagraphtext: replace the timber sale licences that will expire within one year, and the timber sale licences that are surrendered under paragraph (b),
authorize timber to be harvested in one or more timber supply areas within which the areas covered by the timber sale licences described in subparagraph (i) are situated,

subject to subsection (6), specify the allowable annual cut for which the regional manager determines that the designated applicant is eligible in that capacity in respect of the timber sale licences described in subparagraph (i), and
have a term commencing

clause.clausetext: not later than the expiry of the timber sale licence if one timber sale licence is being replaced, or
on a date determined by the regional manager or district manager if 2 or more timber sale licences are being replaced, and

paragraph.paragraphtext: surrender one or more timber sale licences referred to in subsection (1).

subsection.subsectiontext: Despite subsection (3), if the regional manager or district manager determines that

paragraph.paragraphtext: rights under a timber sale licence referred to in subsection (1) are under suspension, or
the designated applicant has failed to

subparagraph.subparagraphtext: pay stumpage or other money payable in respect of timber harvested under a timber sale licence referred to in subsection (1) or a road permit associated with the timber sale licence,

provide security or a deposit required under this Act or the regulations or the Forest and Range Practices Act or the regulations made under that Act in respect of the timber sale licence referred to in subsection (1) or a road permit associated with the timber sale licence,
perform an obligation under the timber sale licence referred to in subsection (1) to be performed by the designated applicant in respect of an area of land specified in

clause.clausetext: a cutting permit previously issued under the timber sale licence, or
a road permit associated with the timber sale licence, or

subparagraph.subparagraphtext: comply with a requirement of the Forest and Range Practices Act or the regulations or the standards made under that Act in respect of an area of land referred to in subparagraph (iii),

section.subsandwich: the regional manager or district manager, to the extent provided in the regulations,

paragraph.paragraphtext: may decline to replace a timber sale licence referred to in subsection (1) until

subparagraph.subparagraphtext: the suspension is rescinded,
the suspended rights are reinstated, or
the designated applicant

clause.clausetext: pays the stumpage or other money payable,
provides the required security or deposit,
performs the obligation to be performed under the timber sale licence in respect of land referred to in paragraph (b) (iii), or
complies with the requirement of the Forest and Range Practices Act or the regulations or the standards made under that Act in respect of land referred to in paragraph (b) (iii), and

paragraph.paragraphtext: may replace the timber sale licence with a timber sale licence containing special conditions.

subsection.subsectiontext: A timber sale licence referred to in subsection (1) must not be replaced if the regional manager or district manager makes a determination under subsection (4) and the timber sale licence expires before

paragraph.paragraphtext: the suspension is rescinded,
the suspended rights are reinstated, or
the designated applicant

clause.clausetext: pays the stumpage or other money payable,
provides the required security or deposit,
performs the obligation to be performed under the timber sale licence in respect of land referred to in subsection (4) (b) (iii), or
complies with the requirement of the Forest and Range Practices Act or the regulations or the standards made under that Act in respect of land referred to in subsection (4) (b) (iii).

subsection.subsectiontext: A determination made by a regional manager under subsection (3) (a) (iii) must be equal to

paragraph.paragraphtext: the allowable annual cut in respect of the timber sale licences described in subsection (3) (a) (i) for which the designated applicant was eligible under section 17 (1a) of the former Act, plus increases and minus decreases, if any, in the allowable annual cut made by the government, and
if the regional manager so designates, all or part of the allowable annual cut specified in the timber sale licences that were not subject to section 17 (1a) of the former Act.

subsection.subsectiontext: The holder of a timber sale licence issued under subsection (2), the "original licence", may apply for and, subject to the original licence being surrendered, the regional manager or district manager and the applicant may enter into a non-replaceable timber sale licence having a volume not greater than 10 times the allowable annual cut of the original licence.

bcl:section.bcl:text: In this Division, pre-existing licence means a timber sale licence that

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: was entered into under section 24 of this Act before that section's repeal by the Forest (Revitalization) Amendment Act (No. 2), 2003, and
is still in effect immediately before that repeal.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Conversion of timber sale licence to forest licence
bcl:section.bcl:text: On the coming into force of this section, a pre-existing licence that has an allowable annual cut greater than 10 000 m3 is converted into a replaceable forest licence that

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: is held by the same person who was the holder of the pre-existing licence,
has a term of 15 years beginning on the date this section comes into force,
specifies the same timber supply area as did the pre-existing licence, and
includes other terms and conditions that are substantially the same as in the pre-existing licence.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Addition of timber sale licence allowable annual cut to forest licence

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: In this section, replaceable forest licence includes one resulting from the conversion under section 24.2 of a pre-existing licence.
If, on the coming into force of this section, a person

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: holds any replaceable forest licence and one or more pre-existing licences, and

the pre-existing licence or each of them, if more than one, has an allowable annual cut of 10 000 m3 or less and authorizes harvesting within the same timber supply area specified in the replaceable forest licence,

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: the replaceable forest licence is amended, effective on the date this section comes into force, by increasing its allowable annual cut by an amount equal to

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the allowable annual cut of the pre-existing licence described in paragraph (b), if the person holds only one such pre-existing licence, or
the total of the allowable annual cuts of the pre-existing licences described in paragraph (b), if the person holds more than one such pre-existing licence.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A pre-existing licence to which subsection (2) applies is deemed to have been surrendered on the coming into force of this section.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Addition of timber sale licence allowable annual cut to forest licence on application

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: In this section, forest licence includes one resulting from the conversion under section 24.2 of a pre-existing licence.
If, after the coming into force of this section, a person

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: holds any non-replaceable forest licence and one or more pre-existing licences,
does not hold any replaceable forest licence in the timber supply area specified in the non-replaceable forest licence, and
the pre-existing licence or each of them, if more than one, authorize harvesting within the same timber supply area specified in the non-replaceable forest licence,

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: the non-replaceable forest licence, on application by its holder within one year after the coming into force of this section, must be amended by the minister by increasing its allowable annual cut by an amount equal to

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the allowable annual cut of the pre-existing licence referred to in paragraph (c), if the person holds only one such pre-existing licence, or
the total of the allowable annual cuts of the pre-existing licences referred to in paragraph (c), if the person holds more than one such pre-existing licence.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If, after the coming into force of this section, a person

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: holds a forest licence and one or more pre-existing licences,
the pre-existing licence or each of them, if more than one, authorizes harvesting within a different timber supply area than the one specified in forest licence, and
the minister determines that there is sufficient timber available in the timber supply area specified in the forest licence,

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: the forest licence, on application by its holder within one year after the coming into force of this section, must be amended by the minister by increasing its allowable annual cut by an amount equal to

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the allowable annual cut of the pre-existing licence described in paragraph (b), if the person holds only one such pre-existing licence, or
the total of the allowable annual cuts of the pre-existing licences described in paragraph (b), if the person holds more than one such pre-existing licence.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A pre-existing licence to which subsection (2) or (3) applies is deemed to have been surrendered on the date of the allowable annual cut increase under subsection (2) or (3).

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Addition of timber sale licence to woodlot licence

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If, after the coming into force of this section,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a person holds

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: one or more pre-existing licences, and
a woodlot licence, and

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the minister determines that there is available Crown land that can reasonably be included in the woodlot licence area,

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: the woodlot licence, on application by its holder within one year after the coming into force of this section, must be amended by the minister by adding to its area a part of the available Crown land referred to in paragraph (b) that is sufficient to increase the allowable annual cut of the woodlot licence by an amount that is equal to at least 80% but not more than 120% of

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the allowable annual cut of the pre-existing licence referred to in paragraph (a), if the person holds only one such pre-existing licence, or
the total of the allowable annual cuts of the pre-existing licences referred to in paragraph (a), if the person holds more than one such pre-existing licence.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A pre-existing licence to which subsection (1) applies is deemed to have been surrendered on the date of the allowable annual cut increase under subsection (1).
Section 45 (1) (b) (ii) does not apply to a woodlot licence amended under subsection (1) of this section.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Surrender of timber sale licence for forest licence

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: In this section, pre-existing licence, in relation to the holder of it, includes that holder's other pre-existing licences, if any, that pertain to the same timber supply area.
If, after the coming into force of this section, a person

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: holds a pre-existing licence that has an allowable annual cut of 2 000 m3 or more, and
the minister receives an application from the holder within one year after this section comes into force to surrender the pre-existing licence for a replaceable forest licence,

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: the minister, subject to subsection (3), must enter into a replaceable forest licence with the holder of the pre-existing licence, which replaceable forest licence

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: is held by the same person who was the holder of the pre-existing licence,
has a term of 15 years beginning on the date the application is received by the minister,
specifies the same timber supply area as did the pre-existing licence,
specifies an allowable annual cut that is the same as the allowable annual cut of the pre-existing licence, and
includes other terms and conditions that are substantially the same as in the pre-existing licence.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The minister must not enter into a forest licence under this section until the holder of the pre-existing licence surrenders the pre-existing licence.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Surrender of timber sale licence for woodlot licence

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: In this section, pre-existing licence, in relation to the holder of it, includes that holder's other pre-existing licences, if any.
Subject to subsection (3), if after the coming into force of this section,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a person holds a pre-existing licence that has an allowable annual cut of at least 800 m3 but not more than 2 500 m3, and
the minister determines that there is available Crown land that can reasonably be included in any woodlot licence area,

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: on application by its holder received by the regional manager or district manager within one year after the coming into force of this section, the minister must enter into a woodlot licence with the holder of the pre-existing licence, which woodlot licence

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: holds a pre-existing licence, and

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: is held by the same person who was the holder of the pre-existing licence,

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: may be harvested from the area of land described in the forestry licence to cut that is in the same timber supply area to which the pre-existing licence pertains, and

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The minister must not enter into forestry licence to cut under this section until the holder of the pre-existing licence surrenders the pre-existing licence.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: In this section, pre-existing licence means a pre-existing licence to which sections 24.2 to 24.8 do not apply and, in relation to the holder of it, includes that holder's other pre-existing licences, if any, in the same timber supply area.

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: has a term of equal to the unexpired portion of the term of the pre-existing licence,
describes an area of land within which its holder may harvest timber that is the same timber supply area to which the pre-existing licence pertains,

specifies a volume of timber that may be harvested under the forestry licence to cut that is equal to a volume of timber that is the sum of the allowable annual cuts of the pre-existing licence for the unexpired portion of its term, and
includes other terms and conditions that are substantially the same as in the pre-existing licence.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A pre-existing licence to which subsection (2) applies is deemed to have been surrendered on the date it is converted into a forestry licence to cut.

subsection.subsectiontext: In this section, original licence means a timber sale licence or forest licence that is the subject of an order under subsection (2).

paragraph.paragraphtext: be fully allocated to one of the timber supply areas resulting from the division, or

subsection.subsectiontext: If an order is made under subsection (2), the regional manager, in accordance with subsection (4), must issue to the holder of the original licence one or more licences in substitution for the original licence.

paragraph.paragraphtext: must specify one of the timber supply areas resulting from the division and authorize an allowable annual cut as necessary to give effect to the order of the minister under subsection (2),

subsection.subsectiontext: After giving the holder of the original licence an opportunity to be heard, the regional manager, at the time of issuing a licence under subsection (3), may include in it terms and conditions that vary from those in the original licence to the extent only that the regional manager considers necessary in order to take into account the allocation referred to in subsection (2).

A timber sale licence or forest licence issued to the holder of the original licence in accordance with subsections (3) and (4) is binding on the government and on that holder and is deemed to be an agreement, in the form of a timber sale licence or a forest licence, as the case may be, entered into by the regional manager and that holder under section 12.

No compensation is payable by the government and proceedings must not be commenced or maintained to claim compensation from the government or to obtain a declaration that compensation is payable by the government in respect of the effect of this section on a forest licence or timber sale licence.

subsection.subsectiontext: On request or on the minister's own initiative, the minister, by advertising in the prescribed manner, may invite applications for a tree farm licence.
The minister must not enter into a tree farm licence under this section unless he or she advertises as provided in subsection (1) and a public hearing is held on the applications.
The application must be made to the minister in a form required by the minister and

paragraph.paragraphtext: must include a description of every private tenure held by the applicant in and near the area of land proposed for the tree farm licence, and

if requested by the minister in the advertising, must include a proposal, providing the information the minister requests, for the continuance, establishment or expansion of a timber processing facility in British Columbia.

subsection.subsectiontext: After a date specified in the advertising, the minister or the minister's designate must

paragraph.paragraphtext: convene a public hearing in which any person may make a submission respecting applications for the tree farm licence, and
determine the procedures for the public hearing.

subsection.subsectiontext: Following the public hearing the minister must evaluate each application, including its potential for

paragraph.paragraphtext: creating or maintaining employment opportunities and other social benefits in British Columbia,
providing for the management and utilization of Crown timber,
furthering the development objectives of the government,
meeting the objectives of the government in respect of environmental quality and the management of water, fisheries, wildlife and cultural heritage resources, and
contributing to government revenues.

subsection.subsectiontext: The Lieutenant Governor in Council, on recommendation of the minister, may approve an application for the tree farm licence.
The minister must not enter into an agreement in the form of a tree farm licence until the chief forester approves a management plan for the proposed tree farm licence area.

The minister may reserve from disposition under this Act the timber in the area described in the advertising, pending the entering into of an agreement in the form of a tree farm licence or rejection of all applications made under this section.
Subject to subsection (7), the minister must enter into an agreement in the form of a tree farm licence with an applicant whose application is approved under subsection (6).
This section does not apply to a tree farm licence entered into under section 34, 36 or 39.

subsection.subsectiontext: The application must be made to the minister in a form required by the minister and must include a description of every private tenure, timber sale licence and forest licence held by the applicant in and near the area of land proposed for the tree farm licence.

paragraph.paragraphtext: creating or maintaining employment opportunities and other social benefits in British Columbia,

furthering the development objectives of the government,
meeting the objectives of the government in respect of environmental quality and the management of water, fisheries, wildlife and cultural heritage resources, and

paragraph.paragraphtext: convene a public hearing in which any person may make a submission respecting the application, and

Subject to subsection (6), the minister must enter into an agreement in the form of a tree farm licence with an applicant whose application is approved under subsection (5).

In respect of all or part of the portion of the allowable annual cut of a licence surrendered under subsection (1) that is not replaced by a tree farm licence, the regional manager, with the approval of the minister, may enter into with the holder a forest licence under section 17 or a timber sale licence under section 24 (3).

The allowable annual cut provided for by the licences issued under subsections (7) and (8) must not be less than 90% of the total of the allowable annual cut provided under the surrendered licence or licences.
If the minister is satisfied that the holder of the licence has taken or will take additional steps that will support and encourage

paragraph.paragraphtext: further processing of the timber resource in British Columbia,
increased utilization of the forests, or
equity in long term timber supplies and increased opportunities for industry growth and development,

subsection.subsectiontext: If the minister determines that

paragraph.paragraphtext: wood chips, sawdust, shavings, hog fuel or other residues or byproducts of timber processing are produced in an area of British Columbia, or
timber below the standard of utilization then in effect for sawmilling purposes exists on an area of Crown land in a timber supply area or tree farm licence area in British Columbia,

section.subsandwich: or both, in sufficient quantities to warrant the continuance, establishment, or expansion of a timber processing facility, the minister may designate the area as a pulpwood area and may enter into one or more pulpwood agreements for all or a part of that area.

subsection.subsectiontext: If the minister makes a determination under subsection (1) the minister, on request or on his or her own initiative, by advertising in the prescribed manner, may invite applications for one or more pulpwood agreements.
The minister must not enter into a pulpwood agreement under this section unless the minister advertises as provided in subsection (2) and a public hearing is held on the applications.

The application must be made to the minister in a form required by the minister and must include a proposal, providing information the minister requests, for the continuance, establishment or expansion of a timber processing facility in British Columbia.
After a date specified in the advertising, the minister or the minister's designate must

paragraph.paragraphtext: convene a public hearing in which any person may make a submission about applications for the pulpwood agreement, and
determine the procedures for the public hearing.

subsection.subsectiontext: Following the public hearing the minister must evaluate each application, including its potential for

paragraph.paragraphtext: creating or maintaining employment opportunities and other social benefits in British Columbia,
providing for the management and utilization of Crown timber,
furthering the development objectives of the government,
meeting the objectives of the government for environmental quality and the management of water, fisheries and wildlife resources, and
contributing to government revenues.

subsection.subsectiontext: The minister, with the approval of the Lieutenant Governor in Council, may

paragraph.paragraphtext: approve one or more applications,
determine that the pulpwood agreement is to be granted by competition under subsection (8), or
decline to approve all applications.

subsection.subsectiontext: If a pulpwood agreement is to be granted by competition the minister must

paragraph.paragraphtext: determine the form of the pulpwood agreement,
specify a date by which tenders for the agreement must be received by the minister, and

consider every tender received on or before that date, delivered in a sealed container and consisting of an offer to pay to the government, in addition to other amounts payable under this Act and the regulations, stumpage under Part 7 and a bonus offer, if any.

subsection.subsectiontext: After considering the tenders the minister, with the approval of the Lieutenant Governor in Council, must approve the tender containing the highest bonus offer or decline to approve all tenders.
A pulpwood agreement must be entered into by the minister and an applicant whose application or tender is approved under subsection (7) or (9).
This section does not apply to a pulpwood agreement entered into under section 42.

section.sectiontext: A pulpwood agreement must,

paragraph.paragraphtext: subject to section 42, be for a term not exceeding 25 years,
subject to section 42, describe an area of land as a pulpwood area,
require its holder to construct, expand or continue a timber processing facility in accordance with the application for the pulpwood agreement,
require its holder to purchase, as provided in the pulpwood agreement,

subparagraph.subparagraphtext: wood residue produced by timber processing facilities from timber harvested in the pulpwood area, and
pulp logs, as defined in the agreement, from the pulpwood area,

paragraph.paragraphtext: subject to sections 42 (3) (d) and 81, grant to its holder the option to obtain from the regional manager or district manager, without advertising or competition from other applicants, timber sale licences authorizing the harvest from Crown land in the pulpwood area of a maximum annual volume of timber not exceeding the volume, and according to the terms, specified in the pulpwood agreement,
require that its holder must not exercise an option under paragraph (e) without first complying with the requirement under paragraph (d), and

include other terms and conditions, consistent with this Act and the regulations, the Forest Practices Code of British Columbia Act and the regulations and the standards made under that Act, determined by the minister.

subsection.subsectiontext: Unless a pulpwood agreement provides that a replacement for the pulpwood agreement must not be offered, the minister, during the 6 month period following the ninth anniversary of an existing pulpwood agreement, must offer its holder a replacement for the pulpwood agreement.
Despite subsection (1), if the minister determines that

paragraph.paragraphtext: rights under the existing pulpwood agreement or a timber sale licence entered into pursuant to the pulpwood agreement are under suspension, or
the holder of the existing pulpwood agreement has failed to

subparagraph.subparagraphtext: pay stumpage or other money payable in respect of timber harvested under a timber sale licence entered into pursuant to the pulpwood agreement or a road permit associated with the timber sale licence,

provide security or a deposit required under this Act or the regulations or the Forest Practices Code of British Columbia Act or the regulations made under that Act in respect of the pulpwood agreement, a timber sale licence entered into pursuant to the pulpwood agreement or a road permit associated with a timber sale licence entered into pursuant to the pulpwood agreement,
perform an obligation under a timber sale licence entered into pursuant to the pulpwood agreement to be performed by the holder in respect of an area of land specified in

clause.clausetext: the timber sale licence,
a cutting permit issued under the timber sale licence, or
a road permit associated with the timber sale licence, or

subparagraph.subparagraphtext: comply with a requirement of the Forest Practices Code of British Columbia Act or the regulations or the standards made under that Act in respect of an area of land referred to in subparagraph (iii),

section.subsandwich: the minister, to the extent provided in the regulations,

paragraph.paragraphtext: may decline to offer a replacement for the existing pulpwood agreement until

subparagraph.subparagraphtext: the suspension is rescinded,
the suspended rights are reinstated, or
the holder of the existing pulpwood agreement

clause.clausetext: pays the stumpage or other money payable,
provides the required security or deposit,
performs the obligation to be performed under the timber sale licence entered into pursuant to the existing pulpwood agreement in respect of land referred to in paragraph (b) (iii), or
complies with the requirement of the Forest Practices Code of British Columbia Act or the regulations or the standards made under that Act in respect of land referred to in paragraph (b) (iii), and

paragraph.paragraphtext: may offer a replacement with special conditions.

subsection.subsectiontext: A pulpwood agreement offered under this section must

paragraph.paragraphtext: have a term commencing

subparagraph.subparagraphtext: on the 10th anniversary of the existing pulpwood agreement, or
if the minister exercises the power conferred under subsection (2) (c), on a date to be determined by the minister,

paragraph.paragraphtext: be for a term equal to

subparagraph.subparagraphtext: the whole original term of the existing pulpwood agreement, or
if the minister exercises the power conferred under subsection (2) (c), a period, not exceeding the original term of the existing pulpwood agreement, to be determined by the minister,

paragraph.paragraphtext: describe as a pulpwood area the area described in the existing pulpwood agreement,
specify a maximum volume of timber that its holder would be eligible to harvest each year during its term equal to the maximum volume specified in the existing pulpwood agreement, and

include other terms and conditions, consistent with this Act and the regulations, the Forest Practices Code of British Columbia Act and the regulations and the standards made under that Act, set out in the offer.

subsection.subsectiontext: A notice of an offer made under this section must be published in the prescribed manner.
An offer made under this section

paragraph.paragraphtext: may be amended, and
may be accepted by written notice to the minister not later than 3 months after the offer is served.

subsection.subsectiontext: If an offer made under this section is accepted,

paragraph.paragraphtext: an agreement in the form of a pulpwood agreement containing the terms and conditions set out in the offer, including amendments, must be entered into by the minister and the holder of the pulpwood agreement, and
the pulpwood agreement then in force expires on the commencement of the replacement licence.

subsection.subsectiontext: If an offer made this under section is not accepted, the existing pulpwood agreement continues in force until its term expires, after which it has no further effect.
No pulpwood agreement is renewable.

section.marginalnote: Consolidation and subdivision of pulpwood agreements

subsection.subsectiontext: With the consent of the licensee the minister may

paragraph.paragraphtext: consolidate 2 or more pulpwood agreements into a pulpwood agreement,
partition or subdivide a pulpwood agreement into 2 or more pulpwood agreements,
delete all or part of the area from a pulpwood agreement and add the deleted area to the area of another pulpwood agreement,
cancel a pulpwood agreement if the area covered by the agreement has been added to the area in another pulpwood agreement,
amend a pulpwood agreement, and
enter into one or more pulpwood agreements covering the same land as was covered in the agreement being consolidated, subdivided or partitioned.

subsection.subsectiontext: Despite section 41 (a), a pulpwood agreement that is amended or entered into under this section must not expire later than the earliest expiry date of the pulpwood agreements it replaces or amends.

subsection.subsectiontext: On request or on his or her own initiative the minister or person authorized by the minister, by advertising in the prescribed manner, may invite applications for a probationary community forest agreement.
An application for a probationary community forest agreement must meet prescribed requirements.
A probationary community forest agreement may be entered into only with an applicant that is

paragraph.paragraphtext: a first nation,
a municipality or regional district, or
any of the following if prescribed requirements are met:

subparagraph.subparagraphtext: a society incorporated under the Society Act;
an association as defined in the Cooperative Association Act;
a corporation;
a partnership.

subsection.subsectiontext: The minister or a person authorized by the minister must evaluate applications for a probationary community forest agreement in accordance with prescribed requirements.
After evaluating applications under subsection (4), the person who evaluated the applications may

paragraph.paragraphtext: approve an application,
approve an application subject to conditions with which the applicant must comply before the probationary community forest agreement is entered into, or
decline to approve all applications.

subsection.subsectiontext: If an applicant whose application is approved under subsection (5) does not enter into the probationary community forest agreement, the minister or a person authorized by the minister may

paragraph.paragraphtext: approve the next best application,
approve the next best application subject to conditions with which the applicant must comply before the probationary community forest agreement is entered into, or
refuse to approve any of the applications.

subsection.subsectiontext: Subject to subsection (8), the regional manager or district manager must enter into probationary community forest agreement with every applicant whose application is approved under subsection (5) or (6).

The regional manager or district manager must not enter into a probationary community forest agreement until a management plan is approved by the regional manager or district manager for the proposed probationary community forest agreement area.
The minister may reserve from disposition under this Act the timber in the area described in the advertising, pending

paragraph.paragraphtext: a probationary community forest agreement being entered into under this section, or
a refusal under subsection (6) to approve any of the applications.

After a probationary community forest agreement has been entered into under subsection (1) with a first nation or its representative, the regional manager or district manager may, if it furthers the objectives set out in subsection (1) (a), and with the consent of the holder of the probationary community forest agreement, do one or both of the following:

subsection.subsectiontext: The regional manager or district manager may enter into a community forest agreement if

paragraph.paragraphtext: the community forest agreement provides that it is entered into with a first nation or its representative to implement or further an agreement between the first nation and the government respecting treaty-related measures, interim measures or economic measures, or
the community forest agreement is entered into under prescribed circumstances or its holder meets prescribed requirements.

subsection.subsectiontext: Before entering into a community forest agreement under subsection (1) with the representative of a first nation, the regional manager or district manager must be satisfied that the intended holder of the community forest agreement is a person or other legal entity and has been appointed by the first nation as its representative.

After a community forest agreement has been entered into under subsection (1) with a first nation or its representative, the regional manager or district manager may, if it furthers the objectives set out in subsection (1) (a), and with the consent of the holder of the community forest agreement, increase the area covered by the community forest agreement.
Section 43.2 does not apply to a community forest agreement entered into under this section.

bcl:section.bcl:text: In this Division and in section 47.3, qualifying timber means Crown timber, whether standing, felled or fallen, that is

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: left on the site of a logging operation after that operation has concluded, other than timber left to fulfill a forest management function, such as

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: a seed tree,
a wildlife tree, or
a log or stump that provides habitat for plants or animals or is a source of nutrients for soil development,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: dead, damaged, diseased, infested or windthrown, or
removed in accordance with a community salvage licence to provide access to timber described in paragraph (a) or (b) or to ensure the safety of a person harvesting that timber.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: On request or on the minister's own initiative, the minister or a person authorized by the minister,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: may invite an application for a community salvage licence, or
by advertising in the prescribed manner, may invite one or more applications for a community salvage licence

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: only from

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a band as defined in the Indian Act (Canada),
a municipality or regional district, or
any of the following if prescribed requirements are met:

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: a society as defined in the Societies Act;
an association as defined in the Cooperative Association Act;
a corporation;
a partnership.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: An application for a community salvage licence must

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: be in the form specified by the minister or a person authorized by the minister,
if it is an application referred to in subsection (1) (b) be submitted in a sealed container to the minister or a person authorized by the minister,
include a proposal to achieve the objectives set out in subsection (3) by harvesting and using qualifying timber,

include any information respecting the proposal referred to in paragraph (c) that the minister or a person authorized by the minister requests when inviting the application under subsection (1) (a) or advertising under subsection (1) (b), and
include an offer by the applicant to pay to the government, in addition to other amounts payable under this Act,

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: stumpage under Part 7, and

waste assessments for qualifying timber, whether standing, felled or fallen, that could have been cut or removed under the community salvage licence, but, at the licensee's discretion, is not cut or removed.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The minister or a person authorized by the minister must evaluate each application, taking into account its potential for

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: providing social and economic benefits to British Columbia, including contributing to government revenues,
providing opportunities for achieving a range of community objectives, including employment and other social, environmental and economic benefits,
encouraging cooperation within the community and among stakeholders,
providing for the use of qualifying timber, and
other factors that the minister or a person authorized by the minister specifies in the invitation or advertising.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: After the evaluation under subsection (3), the minister or a person authorized by the minister may

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: in the case of an application submitted in response to an invitation under subsection (1) (a)

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: approve the application,
approve the application subject to conditions with which the applicant must comply before the community salvage licence is entered into, or
decline to approve the application, and

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: in the case of an application submitted in response to an advertisement under subsection (1) (b)

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: approve one or more applications,
approve an application subject to conditions that the applicant must comply with before the community salvage licence is entered into, or
decline to approve any applications.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If the person whose application is approved under subsection (4) (b) does not enter into the community salvage licence, the minister or a person authorized by the minister may approve the next best application from a qualified applicant.
If an application is approved under this section, the minister must enter into a community salvage licence with the applicant.

bcl:section.bcl:text: A community salvage licence

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: must be for a term not exceeding 5 years,
must describe one or more areas of land within which, subject to availability, its holder may harvest qualifying timber,
may specify a maximum volume of qualifying timber that may be harvested from an area of land described in the community salvage licence,

may provide for cutting permits to be issued by the district manager to authorize its holder to harvest qualifying timber from specified areas of land within the area or areas of land described in the community salvage licence,
must require its holder to pay to the government, in addition to other amounts payable under this Act,

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: stumpage under Part 7, and

waste assessments for merchantable qualifying timber, whether standing, felled or fallen, that could have been cut or removed under the community salvage licence, but, at its holder's discretion, is not cut or removed,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: may include restrictions on

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the type of qualifying timber that may be harvested under it, and
the location, timing, nature and extent of harvesting activities that may be carried out under it,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: if it authorizes clearcutting, must restrict clearcuts to less than one hectare,

that is entered into with a first nation or its representative to implement or further an agreement between the first nation and the government respecting treaty-related measures, interim measures or economic measures, must state that it is a condition of the community salvage licence that the first nation comply with the agreement, and

may include other terms and conditions, consistent with this Act, the Forest and Range Practices Act, the Wildfire Act and any regulations or standards made under those Acts, determined by the minister.

subsection.subsectiontext: In this section, control with respect to a corporation in subsection (6) has the same meaning as "control of a corporation" in section 53.
On request or on his or her own initiative the regional manager or district manager, by advertising in the prescribed manner, may invite applications for woodlot licences.
A woodlot licence must not be entered into under this section unless the regional manager or district manager advertises as provided under subsection (2).
An application for a woodlot licence must be made to the district manager or regional manager in a form required by the regional manager and must include

paragraph.paragraphtext: a description of any private land owned by the applicant contiguous to or in the vicinity of the area of Crown land described in the advertising, and
a declaration by or on behalf of the applicant attesting to the qualifications of the applicant for a woodlot licence.

subsection.subsectiontext: A woodlot licence must be entered into only with

paragraph.paragraphtext: a Canadian citizen or permanent resident of Canada who is 19 years of age or older,
a band as defined in the Indian Act (Canada), or
a corporation, other than a society, that is controlled by persons who meet the qualifications referred to in paragraph (a).

subsection.subsectiontext: A woodlot licence must not be entered into with a person, corporation or band that

paragraph.paragraphtext: owns or leases, or controls a corporation that owns or leases, a timber processing facility in British Columbia, or
holds another woodlot licence.

subsection.subsectiontext: The regional manager or district manager must evaluate all applications for a woodlot licence and, in evaluating the applications, he or she must consider

paragraph.paragraphtext: the place of residence of every applicant and, if the applicant is a corporation, the place of residence of each of its members,
the location and character of any private land, owned by every applicant, contiguous to or in the vicinity of the area of Crown land described in the applications, and
other factors that the regional manager or district manager considers to be consistent with the goals of the woodlot licence program.

subsection.subsectiontext: After evaluating applications under subsection (7), the person who evaluated the applications may

paragraph.paragraphtext: approve an application,
decline to approve all applications, or
designate 2 or more of the applications as eligible to proceed to competition under subsection (9) to decide which application will be granted.

subsection.subsectiontext: If a woodlot licence is to be granted by competition the regional manager or district manager must

paragraph.paragraphtext: determine the form of the licence,
specify a date by which tenders for the licence must be received by him or her, and

consider every tender received on or before that date, delivered in a sealed container and consisting of an offer to pay to the government, in addition to other amounts payable under this Act and the regulations, stumpage under Part 7 and a bonus, if any, in the amount tendered.

subsection.subsectiontext: After considering the tenders the regional manager or district manager must approve the tender containing the highest bonus offer or, at the direction of the minister, decline to approve all tenders.

If the person whose application is approved under subsection (8) or whose tender is approved under subsection (10) neglects or declines to enter into the woodlot licence or becomes ineligible to enter into the licence, the regional manager or district manager may approve the next best woodlot application or tender, or, at the direction of the minister, may refuse to approve any of the applications or tenders.

Neither the regional manager nor the district manager is to enter into an agreement in the form of a woodlot licence until a management plan is approved by the government for the proposed woodlot licence area.

The regional manager or district manager may reserve from disposition under this Act the timber in the area described in the advertising, pending the entering into of an agreement in the form of a woodlot licence or rejection of all applications made under this section.

Subject to subsection (11), the regional manager or district manager must enter into an agreement in the form of a woodlot licence with every person whose application or tender is approved under subsection (8) or (10).

section.marginalnote: Cancellation for failure to obtain consent

subsection.subsectiontext: If the minister determines that there has been a failure to obtain the consent required by section 54, the minister, without notice and despite section 77, may cancel the agreement in respect of which the failure occurred.

If the minister determines that there has been a failure to obtain the consent required by section 54, other than a failure that occurred as a result of a failure to meet the requirements of section 54 (3), but decides not to cancel the agreement in respect of which the failure occurred, the minister is deemed to have given consent for the purposes of section 56.
If the minister is deemed to have given consent under subsection (2), the minister may

paragraph.paragraphtext: impose those conditions and requirements on that consent that the minister considers necessary or advisable, and

without notice and despite section 77, cancel the agreement in respect of which the deemed consent was given if the minister determines that the conditions and requirements imposed under paragraph (a) of this subsection are not complied with.

subsection.subsectiontext: A reduction under subsection (1) or an obligation to pay under subsection (5) (b), other than a reduction or obligation to pay in respect of a consent deemed to have been given under section 55 (2), is effective 14 days after the date on which consent is given unless the minister receives notice in writing, prior to the expiration of the 14 day period, that the transaction in respect of which consent was given will not take place within the 14 day period, in which case the consent is deemed not to have been given.

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the extension factor calculated under subsection (3), if the extension factor is a whole number, or

oasis:entry.oasis:line: the total volume of timber that the licensee would have been entitled to harvest under the licence using the allowable annual cut specified in the licence when the licence was issued less any reductions made under this Act, other than section 63, or the cut control provisions of the licence
